title: LXC (cgroups?) support
body: Linux Kernel provides a way of grouping processes into isolated environments. This is the basis of LXC and Docker. Adding these primitives to the WSL Kernel would help with building applications and packages in a clean environment (see: snapcraft cleanbuild, which uses LXD: https://snapcraft.io/docs/reference/snapcraft-command#cleanbuild) without cluttering our main Ubuntu installation with packages that are not needed for general use, but are needed to build a single package that one time (at band camp).
